meanings.definition: A person who ruins others' fun or enjoyment.
meanings.sent1: The spoilsports at the party complained about the music being too loud.
meanings.sent2: Don't be a spoilsports and let us have a good time at the picnic.
meanings.sent3: The spoilsports in the group always want to leave early and miss out on the fun.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds seemed like spoilsports, threatening to ruin our outdoor barbecue.
meanings.sent5: The spoilsports in the movie always try to stop the main characters from having fun adventures.

meanings.sent1: The spoilsports gathered together to discuss their plans for the upcoming event.
meanings.sent2: Spoilsports like to rain on everyone's parade with their negative attitudes.
meanings.sent3: The spoilsports in the class always sit together and whisper during the lesson.
meanings.sent4: The spoilsports of the neighborhood were known for complaining about any noise after 9 pm.
meanings.sent5: The spoilsports of the town were like a dark cloud over the community events, always finding something to criticize.
